4847.verse-arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ اقْتَرَبَتِ السَّاعَةُ وَانشَقَّ الْقَمَرُ
4847.verse-english: The Hour has come near, and the moon has split [in two].

clauses-english.clause: The Hour has come near,
and the moon has split [in two].

4848.verse-arabic: وَإِن يَرَوْا آيَةً يُعْرِضُوا وَيَقُولُوا سِحْرٌ مُّسْتَمِرٌّ
4848.verse-english: And if they see a miracle, they turn away and say, "Passing magic."

clauses-english.clause: And if they see a miracle,
they turn away and say,
"Passing magic.

4849.verse-arabic: وَكَذَّبُوا وَاتَّبَعُوا أَهْوَاءَهُمْ ۚ وَكُلُّ أَمْرٍ مُّسْتَقِرٌّ
4849.verse-english: And they denied and followed their inclinations. But for every matter is a [time of] settlement.

clauses-english.clause: And they denied and followed their inclinations.
But for every matter is a [time of] settlement.

4850.verse-arabic: وَلَقَدْ جَاءَهُم مِّنَ الْأَنبَاءِ مَا فِيهِ مُزْدَجَرٌ
4850.verse-english: And there has already come to them of information that in which there is deterrence -

clauses-arabic.clause: وَلَقَدْ جَاءَهُم مِّنَ الْأَنبَاءِ مَا فِيهِ مُزْدَجَرٌ

clauses-english.clause: And there has already come to them of information that in which there is deterrence -

4851.verse-english: Extensive wisdom - but warning does not avail [them].

clauses-english.clause: Extensive wisdom -
but warning does not avail [them].

4852.verse-arabic: فَتَوَلَّ عَنْهُمْ ۘ يَوْمَ يَدْعُ الدَّاعِ إِلَىٰ شَيْءٍ نُّكُرٍ
4852.verse-english: So leave them, [O Muhammad]. The Day the Caller calls to something forbidding,

clauses-english.clause: So leave them,
[O Muhammad].
The Day the Caller calls to something forbidding,

4853.verse-arabic: خُشَّعًا أَبْصَارُهُمْ يَخْرُجُونَ مِنَ الْأَجْدَاثِ كَأَنَّهُمْ جَرَادٌ مُّنتَشِرٌ
4853.verse-english: Their eyes humbled, they will emerge from the graves as if they were locusts spreading,

clauses-english.clause: Their eyes humbled,
they will emerge from the graves as if they were locusts spreading,

4854.verse-arabic: مُّهْطِعِينَ إِلَى الدَّاعِ ۖ يَقُولُ الْكَافِرُونَ هَٰذَا يَوْمٌ عَسِرٌ
4854.verse-english: Racing ahead toward the Caller. The disbelievers will say, "This is a difficult Day."

clauses-english.clause: Racing ahead toward the Caller.
The disbelievers will say,
"This is a difficult Day.

4855.verse-arabic: ۞ كَذَّبَتْ قَبْلَهُمْ قَوْمُ نُوحٍ فَكَذَّبُوا عَبْدَنَا وَقَالُوا مَجْنُونٌ وَازْدُجِرَ
4855.verse-english: The people of Noah denied before them, and they denied Our servant and said, "A madman," and he was repelled.

clauses-english.clause: The people of Noah denied before them,
and they denied Our servant and said,
"A madman,
" and he was repelled.

4856.verse-english: So he invoked his Lord, "Indeed, I am overpowered, so help."

clauses-english.clause: So he invoked his Lord,
"Indeed,
I am overpowered,
so help.

4857.verse-english: Then We opened the gates of the heaven with rain pouring down

clauses-english.clause: Then We opened the gates of the heaven with rain pouring down

4858.verse-arabic: وَفَجَّرْنَا الْأَرْضَ عُيُونًا فَالْتَقَى الْمَاءُ عَلَىٰ أَمْرٍ قَدْ قُدِرَ
4858.verse-english: And caused the earth to burst with springs, and the waters met for a matter already predestined.

clauses-english.clause: And caused the earth to burst with springs,
and the waters met for a matter already predestined.

4859.verse-english: And We carried him on a [construction of] planks and nails,

clauses-english.clause: And We carried him on a [construction of] planks and nails,

4860.verse-arabic: تَجْرِي بِأَعْيُنِنَا جَزَاءً لِّمَن كَانَ كُفِرَ
4860.verse-english: Sailing under Our observation as reward for he who had been denied.

clauses-arabic.clause: تَجْرِي بِأَعْيُنِنَا جَزَاءً لِّمَن كَانَ كُفِرَ

clauses-english.clause: Sailing under Our observation as reward for he who had been denied.

4861.verse-arabic: وَلَقَد تَّرَكْنَاهَا آيَةً فَهَلْ مِن مُّدَّكِرٍ
4861.verse-english: And We left it as a sign, so is there any who will remember?

clauses-english.clause: And We left it as a sign,
so is there any who will remember?

4862.verse-english: And how [severe] were My punishment and warning.

clauses-english.clause: And how [severe] were My punishment and warning.

4863.verse-arabic: وَلَقَدْ يَسَّرْنَا الْقُرْآنَ لِلذِّكْرِ فَهَلْ مِن مُّدَّكِرٍ
4863.verse-english: And We have certainly made the Qur'an easy for remembrance, so is there any who will remember?

clauses-english.clause: And We have certainly made the Qur'an easy for remembrance,
so is there any who will remember?

4864.verse-arabic: كَذَّبَتْ عَادٌ فَكَيْفَ كَانَ عَذَابِي وَنُذُرِ
4864.verse-english: 'Aad denied; and how [severe] were My punishment and warning.

clauses-english.clause: 'Aad denied;
and how [severe] were My punishment and warning.

4865.verse-arabic: إِنَّا أَرْسَلْنَا عَلَيْهِمْ رِيحًا صَرْصَرًا فِي يَوْمِ نَحْسٍ مُّسْتَمِرٍّ
4865.verse-english: Indeed, We sent upon them a screaming wind on a day of continuous misfortune,

clauses-english.clause: Indeed,
We sent upon them a screaming wind on a day of continuous misfortune,

4866.verse-arabic: تَنزِعُ النَّاسَ كَأَنَّهُمْ أَعْجَازُ نَخْلٍ مُّنقَعِرٍ
4866.verse-english: Extracting the people as if they were trunks of palm trees uprooted.

clauses-arabic.clause: تَنزِعُ النَّاسَ كَأَنَّهُمْ أَعْجَازُ نَخْلٍ مُّنقَعِرٍ

clauses-english.clause: Extracting the people as if they were trunks of palm trees uprooted.

4867.verse-english: And how [severe] were My punishment and warning.

clauses-english.clause: And how [severe] were My punishment and warning.

4868.verse-arabic: وَلَقَدْ يَسَّرْنَا الْقُرْآنَ لِلذِّكْرِ فَهَلْ مِن مُّدَّكِرٍ
4868.verse-english: And We have certainly made the Qur'an easy for remembrance, so is there any who will remember?

clauses-english.clause: And We have certainly made the Qur'an easy for remembrance,
so is there any who will remember?
Thamud denied the warning

4870.verse-arabic: فَقَالُوا أَبَشَرًا مِّنَّا وَاحِدًا نَّتَّبِعُهُ إِنَّا إِذًا لَّفِي ضَلَالٍ وَسُعُرٍ
4870.verse-english: And said, "Is it one human being among us that we should follow? Indeed, we would then be in error and madness.

clauses-english.clause: And said,
"Is it one human being among us that we should follow?
Indeed,
we would then be in error and madness.

4871.verse-arabic: أَأُلْقِيَ الذِّكْرُ عَلَيْهِ مِن بَيْنِنَا بَلْ هُوَ كَذَّابٌ أَشِرٌ
4871.verse-english: Has the message been sent down upon him from among us? Rather, he is an insolent liar."

clauses-english.clause: Has the message been sent down upon him from among us?
Rather,
he is an insolent liar.

4872.verse-english: They will know tomorrow who is the insolent liar.

clauses-english.clause: They will know tomorrow who is the insolent liar.

4873.verse-arabic: إِنَّا مُرْسِلُو النَّاقَةِ فِتْنَةً لَّهُمْ فَارْتَقِبْهُمْ وَاصْطَبِرْ
4873.verse-english: Indeed, We are sending the she-camel as trial for them, so watch them and be patient.

clauses-english.clause: Indeed,
We are sending the she-
camel as trial for them,
so watch them and be patient.

4874.verse-arabic: وَنَبِّئْهُمْ أَنَّ الْمَاءَ قِسْمَةٌ بَيْنَهُمْ ۖ كُلُّ شِرْبٍ مُّحْتَضَرٌ
4874.verse-english: And inform them that the water is shared between them, each [day of] drink attended [by turn].

clauses-english.clause: And inform them that the water is shared between them,
each [day of] drink attended [by turn].

4875.verse-english: But they called their companion, and he dared and hamstrung [her].

clauses-english.clause: But they called their companion,
and he dared and hamstrung [her].

4876.verse-english: And how [severe] were My punishment and warning.

clauses-english.clause: And how [severe] were My punishment and warning.

4877.verse-arabic: إِنَّا أَرْسَلْنَا عَلَيْهِمْ صَيْحَةً وَاحِدَةً فَكَانُوا كَهَشِيمِ الْمُحْتَظِرِ
4877.verse-english: Indeed, We sent upon them one blast from the sky, and they became like the dry twig fragments of an [animal] pen.

clauses-english.clause: Indeed,
We sent upon them one blast from the sky,
and they became like the dry twig fragments of an [animal] pen.

4878.verse-arabic: وَلَقَدْ يَسَّرْنَا الْقُرْآنَ لِلذِّكْرِ فَهَلْ مِن مُّدَّكِرٍ
4878.verse-english: And We have certainly made the Qur'an easy for remembrance, so is there any who will remember?

clauses-english.clause: And We have certainly made the Qur'an easy for remembrance,
so is there any who will remember?

4879.verse-english: The people of Lot denied the warning.

clauses-english.clause: The people of Lot denied the warning.

4880.verse-arabic: إِنَّا أَرْسَلْنَا عَلَيْهِمْ حَاصِبًا إِلَّا آلَ لُوطٍ ۖ نَّجَّيْنَاهُم بِسَحَرٍ
4880.verse-english: Indeed, We sent upon them a storm of stones, except the family of Lot - We saved them before dawn

clauses-english.clause: Indeed,
We sent upon them a storm of stones,
except the family of Lot -
We saved them before dawn

4881.verse-arabic: نِّعْمَةً مِّنْ عِندِنَا ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِي مَن شَكَرَ
4881.verse-english: As favor from us. Thus do We reward he who is grateful.

clauses-english.clause: As favor from us.
Thus do We reward he who is grateful.

4882.verse-english: And he had already warned them of Our assault, but they disputed the warning.

clauses-english.clause: And he had already warned them of Our assault,
but they disputed the warning.

4883.verse-arabic: وَلَقَدْ رَاوَدُوهُ عَن ضَيْفِهِ فَطَمَسْنَا أَعْيُنَهُمْ فَذُوقُوا عَذَابِي وَنُذُرِ
4883.verse-english: And they had demanded from him his guests, but We obliterated their eyes, [saying], "Taste My punishment and warning."

clauses-english.clause: And they had demanded from him his guests,
but We obliterated their eyes,
[saying],
"Taste My punishment and warning.

4884.verse-english: And there came upon them by morning an abiding punishment.

clauses-english.clause: And there came upon them by morning an abiding punishment.

4885.verse-english: So taste My punishment and warning.

clauses-english.clause: So taste My punishment and warning.

4886.verse-arabic: وَلَقَدْ يَسَّرْنَا الْقُرْآنَ لِلذِّكْرِ فَهَلْ مِن مُّدَّكِرٍ
4886.verse-english: And We have certainly made the Qur'an easy for remembrance, so is there any who will remember?

clauses-english.clause: And We have certainly made the Qur'an easy for remembrance,
so is there any who will remember?

4887.verse-english: And there certainly came to the people of Pharaoh warning.

clauses-english.clause: And there certainly came to the people of Pharaoh warning.

4888.verse-arabic: كَذَّبُوا بِآيَاتِنَا كُلِّهَا فَأَخَذْنَاهُمْ أَخْذَ عَزِيزٍ مُّقْتَدِرٍ
4888.verse-english: They denied Our signs, all of them, so We seized them with a seizure of one Exalted in Might and Perfect in Ability.

clauses-english.clause: They denied Our signs,
all of them,
so We seized them with a seizure of one Exalted in Might and Perfect in Ability.

4889.verse-arabic: أَكُفَّارُكُمْ خَيْرٌ مِّنْ أُولَٰئِكُمْ أَمْ لَكُم بَرَاءَةٌ فِي الزُّبُرِ
4889.verse-english: Are your disbelievers better than those [former ones], or have you immunity in the scripture?

clauses-english.clause: Are your disbelievers better than those [former ones],
or have you immunity in the scripture?

4890.verse-english: Or do they say, "We are an assembly supporting [each other]"?

clauses-english.clause: Or do they say,
"We are an assembly supporting [each other]"?

4891.verse-english: [Their] assembly will be defeated, and they will turn their backs [in retreat].

clauses-english.clause: [Their] assembly will be defeated,
and they will turn their backs [in retreat].

4892.verse-arabic: بَلِ السَّاعَةُ مَوْعِدُهُمْ وَالسَّاعَةُ أَدْهَىٰ وَأَمَرُّ
4892.verse-english: But the Hour is their appointment [for due punishment], and the Hour is more disastrous and more bitter.

clauses-english.clause: But the Hour is their appointment [for due punishment],
and the Hour is more disastrous and more bitter.

4893.verse-english: Indeed, the criminals are in error and madness.

clauses-english.clause: Indeed,
the criminals are in error and madness.

4894.verse-arabic: يَوْمَ يُسْحَبُونَ فِي النَّارِ عَلَىٰ وُجُوهِهِمْ ذُوقُوا مَسَّ سَقَرَ
4894.verse-english: The Day they are dragged into the Fire on their faces [it will be said], "Taste the touch of Saqar."

clauses-english.clause: The Day they are dragged into the Fire on their faces [it will be said],
"Taste the touch of Saqar.

4895.verse-english: Indeed, all things We created with predestination.

clauses-english.clause: Indeed,
all things We created with predestination.

4896.verse-arabic: وَمَا أَمْرُنَا إِلَّا وَاحِدَةٌ كَلَمْحٍ بِالْبَصَرِ
4896.verse-english: And Our command is but one, like a glance of the eye.

clauses-english.clause: And Our command is but one,
like a glance of the eye.

4897.verse-arabic: وَلَقَدْ أَهْلَكْنَا أَشْيَاعَكُمْ فَهَلْ مِن مُّدَّكِرٍ
4897.verse-english: And We have already destroyed your kinds, so is there any who will remember?

clauses-english.clause: And We have already destroyed your kinds,
so is there any who will remember?

4898.verse-english: And everything they did is in written records.

clauses-english.clause: And everything they did is in written records.

4899.verse-english: And every small and great [thing] is inscribed.

clauses-english.clause: And every small and great [thing] is inscribed.

4900.verse-english: Indeed, the righteous will be among gardens and rivers,

clauses-english.clause: Indeed,
the righteous will be among gardens and rivers,

4901.verse-arabic: فِي مَقْعَدِ صِدْقٍ عِندَ مَلِيكٍ مُّقْتَدِرٍ
4901.verse-english: In a seat of honor near a Sovereign, Perfect in Ability.

clauses-english.clause: In a seat of honor near a Sovereign,
Perfect in Ability.
